data: It was dark in the hut.
lit only by the glow from the fire
which burnt in the middle of the room.
Later, the fire would be built up
so that flames would lick the round black cauldron
and heat the stew for the evening meal,
but for now turf had been laid on the logs.
The fire would stay hot and alive,
but would not need to be fed.
Morg knew that fires were as ravenous
as the wolves she heard howling in the woods at night.
